title: Conditions & Basic Logic
concept: This level focuses on decision making in Python using if, elif and else. You will practice comparisons, simple maths and printing specific messages based on conditions.

challenges.title: Positive, Negative or Zero
challenges.description: Read an integer and print Positive if n > 0, Negative if n < 0, and Zero otherwise.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
# write your if-elif-else here

challenges.title: Even or Odd
challenges.description: Print Even if the number is divisible by 2, otherwise print Odd.

challenges.title: Maximum of Two
challenges.description: Read two integers and print the larger one.
challenges.inputDescription: Two integers a and b separated by space.
challenges.starterCode:
a, b = map(int, input().split())
# print the maximum

challenges.title: Minimum of Three
challenges.description: Read three integers and print the smallest one.
challenges.starterCode:
a, b, c = map(int, input().split())
# find and print minimum

challenges.title: Grade Calculator
challenges.description: Given percentage p, print grade: A if p>=90, B if p>=75, C if p>=60, D if p>=40, else Fail.

challenges.title: Divisible by 5 and 11
challenges.description: Print Yes if the number is divisible by BOTH 5 and 11, otherwise print No.

challenges.title: Leap Year
challenges.description: Check if a year is leap year: divisible by 400 OR (divisible by 4 AND not divisible by 100). Print Yes or No.
challenges.starterCode:
year = int(input())
# apply leap year logic

challenges.title: Character Type
challenges.description: Read a single character c. If it is uppercase letter print Uppercase, if lowercase letter print Lowercase, if digit print Digit, else print Symbol.

challenges.title: Simple Calculator
challenges.description: Read two integers a, b and an operator op (+, -, *, /). Perform the operation and print the result. Use integer division for /.
challenges.starterCode:
data = input().split()
a = int(data[0])
b = int(data[1])
op = data[2]
